publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4776 Patrick Harvie: Fingerprinting of Schoolchildren—That the Parliament is deeply concerned that children in some Scottish schools are required to submit to fingerprinting to access school libraries; notes that school libraries have managed to function for generations without needing to treat schoolchildren like criminals; believes that children should be taught in an environment which respects their autonomy and privacy and, indeed, encourages them to hold their civil liberties in high regard, and urges Scottish schools to reject the use of fingerprint systems. Supported by: Mark Ballard*, Mike Rumbles*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Carolyn Leckie*, Frances Curran*, Robin Harper*
S2M-4776 Fingerprinting of Schoolchildren (lodged on 11 September 2006) Shiona Baird*, Chris Ballance*, Rob Gibson*, Eleanor Scott*
S2M-4776 Fingerprinting of Schoolchildren (lodged on 11 September 2006) Mr Mark Ruskell*
S2M-4776 Fingerprinting of Schoolchildren (lodged on 11 September 2006) Alex Johnstone*, Alex Neil*

S2M-4776 Patrick Harvie: Fingerprinting of Schoolchildren—That the Parliament is deeply concerned that children in some Scottish schools are required to submit to fingerprinting to access school libraries; notes that school libraries have managed to function for generations without needing to treat schoolchildren like criminals; believes that children should be taught in an environment which respects their autonomy and privacy and, indeed, encourages them to hold their civil liberties in high regard, and urges Scottish schools to reject the use of fingerprint systems. Supported by: Mark Ballard, Mike Rumbles, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Carolyn Leckie, Frances Curran, Robin Harper, Shiona Baird, Chris Ballance, Rob Gibson, Eleanor Scott, Mr Mark Ruskell, Alex Johnstone, Alex Neil, Dr Jean Turner*
S2M-4776 Fingerprinting of Schoolchildren (lodged on 11 September 2006) Donald Gorrie*
S2M-4776 Fingerprinting of Schoolchildren (lodged on 11 September 2006) Tommy Sheridan*
